attributes.action: Reform parliamentary process to prevent blocking with objections & filibustering
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst these two MP's are not alone between them they have blocked numerous pieces of legislation. Sir Chope's recent block of the Voyerism (upskirting) bill is only one of several -  further details http://www.itv.com/news/2018-06-15/sir-christopher-chope-mp-object-private-members-bill/
MP Davies has filibustered numerous bills including; make homes fit for human habitation - further details https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/philip-davies-filibuster-domestic-violence-a7479266.html
attributes.background: The current process allows a single MP to block a bill through the use of an objection or filibustering. This does not support a democratic parliamentary process, which is meant to represent the views of the people. It is essential that parliamentary process is changed in order to prevent this.
